Sequence Information.Source: Shrimp,Penaeus vannamei, Crustaceans, arthropods, invertebrates, animals

Literature Information.Literature: Discovery: Machine learning predicted from beta-1,3-glucan-binding protein sequence (1454 aa) of Penaeus vannamei (shrimp).Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals this sequence is most similar (53.33%) tofrog Temporin-1RNbL: 27%; K: 20%; R=G: 13%. GRAVY: -0.247; M Wt: 1810.275; Mol formula:  C84H144N24O18S1; molar extinction coeff: 1490.Activity: active against B. subtilis AY867792.1 (MIC 8.6 uM) or (15.6 ug/ml), B. cereus KX890470.1 (MIC 11 uM) or (31.25 ug/ml), and B. nealsonii JQ579625.1 (MIC 31.25 ug/ml). Inhibited biofilm formation of B. subtilis at 0.5x MIC.
Literature Information.Author: Yang S, Yuan Z, Aweya JJ, Deng S, Weng W, Zhang Y, Liu G. 2022
Literature Information.Title: Antibacterial and antibiofilm activity of peptide PvGBP2 against pathogenic bacteria that contaminate Auricularia auricular culture bags
